summary: This bill, the Tribal Self-Determination and Co-Management in Forestry Act of 2025, directs federal land management agencies to establish Tribal Co-Management Plans for activities on lands historically, culturally, or geographically related to Indian Tribes. It authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to enter agreements with Tribes and Tribal organizations for Forest Service activities and mandates training for Interior Department employees on incorporating Indigenous knowledge. The legislation also establishes a reporting and review process, allocates funding, and defines key terms related to agreements and activities.
